title: Remembering a Great Writer: Sir Tom Stoppard
summary: King Charles III and Queen Camilla are leading many people in sharing kind words about Sir Tom Stoppard, a famous writer who has died at age 88. He was called one of the greatest writers and a dear friend. Sir Tom wrote plays and movies, like Shakespeare In Love, which won him an Oscar. He died peacefully at home with his family. People from all over the world are remembering him for his work that made audiences think and feel. Other famous people, like Sir Mick Jagger, also shared how much they admired him. Sir Tom was known for his wit and joy in life. He wrote many stories for the stage, film, and TV, and received honors for his writing. His plays, such as Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead, are still loved today.

background_read: Sir Tom Stoppard was a very important writer from Britain who wrote plays, movies, and TV shows. He was born in 1937 and became famous for his smart and funny stories. Many people loved his work because it made them think about big ideas. He got a special title called 'Sir' from the Queen because he was so good at writing. His plays are performed all over the world, and he won many awards, including an Oscar for a movie. He lived a long life and was happy, often making people laugh with his clever words.

WHAT: They are sharing tributes and memories after Sir Tom Stoppard's death, celebrating his life and work
WHERE: This happened in Dorset where he died, and tributes came from around the world
WHY: To honor Sir Tom as a great writer and comfort his family, showing how much he was loved
